title: Middle size, 80 000 lines, project but very slow, 5 hours, compilation

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: I-compiletime
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to compile times.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This code is the [MAVLink ](https://mavlink.io/en/) protocol handler, and generated by one of the MAVLink specification. It is  **C/Rust**  mixed project, so to compile it you will need  **Rust** ,  **CC**  an any  **C**  compiler.

To check how slow  **rustc**  is, [check this out ](https://github.com/cheblin/InRUST), and run  **cargo test**  in the  **GroundControl/demo**  dir

Exactly this project is compiled with error, cause the borrow checker complains in one place.

But anyway, the problem is that compilation is unacceptably slow.

**Description**

[/GroundControl/lib ](https://github.com/cheblin/InRUST/blob/master/GroundControl/lib/src/lib.rs)  **generated API**

[/GroundControl/demo/src/use_case](https://github.com/cheblin/InRUST/blob/master/GroundControl/demo/src/use_case.rs)  **is generated sample of using generated API**

[/GroundControl/demo/src/test](https://github.com/cheblin/InRUST/blob/master/GroundControl/demo/src/test.rs)  **the test**

I generate variation of this project, with same functionality, in C, C++, C#.... They are the compiled in seconds !

What wrong with my Rust project? How can I speed up compilation?

My PC

Intel I7-7700K

RAM 32G

SSD Samsung 970 PRO

**cargo -V**

cargo 1.39.0-nightly (ab6fa8908 2019-09-25)

**rustc -V**

rustc 1.40.0-nightly (22bc9e1d9 2019-09-30)
